keyEvents.description: Luffy and Sanji encounter a herd of dangerous Lapahns while climbing the mountain to reach the doctor.
keyEvents.significance: The treacherous terrain and wildlife create significant obstacles for the crew's mission to save Nami.

keyEvents.description: The Lapahns trigger a massive avalanche that engulfs Luffy and Sanji.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the extreme danger of this mountain range and the intelligence of its wildlife.

description: The Drum Rockies is a treacherous mountain range on Drum Island, characterized by steep cliffs, heavy snow, and dangerous wildlife including carnivorous Lapahns. The mountains must be climbed to reach Dr. Kureha's location at Drum Castle.
climate: Extreme cold, heavy snowfall, prone to avalanches

keyEvents.description: Dr. Kureha treats a sick boy at a restaurant in Cocoa Weed, performing surgery and demanding unusual payment.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Kureha's reputation as an effective but eccentric doctor in the village.

description: Cocoa Weed is a village on Drum Island where many of the island's inhabitants live. It features restaurants and homes where Dr. Kureha occasionally visits to treat the sick.
politicalStatus: Part of Drum Island, formerly under Wapol's tyrannical rule

keyEvents.description: Wapol and the Bliking Pirates arrive at Drum Island's coast, seeking to reclaim the kingdom.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the return of tyranny to the island and sets up the arc's main conflict.

keyEvents.description: Tony Tony Chopper makes his first appearance on Drum Island, traveling with Dr. Kureha.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction of a future Straw Hat crew member in his home environment.

description: Drum Island is a winter island in the Grand Line known for its constant snow and cold climate. It was formerly ruled by the tyrannical King Wapol who abandoned it when Blackbeard attacked. The island is famous for its doctors, though most were exiled by Wapol, leaving only Dr. Kureha and Dr. Hiriluk (deceased). The island features dangerous wildlife including Lapahns and challenging terrain.
climate: Perpetual winter, constant snowfall, extreme cold
politicalStatus: Formerly a kingdom under Wapol, currently in transition after his abandonment

keyEvents.description: The villagers inform Usopp and Vivi that the doctor (Kureha) is located at the castle on the other side of the island.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the castle as the destination for Luffy and Sanji's dangerous journey and Dr. Kureha's residence.

description: Drum Castle is located atop the Drum Rockies and serves as the residence of Dr. Kureha. It was formerly the royal palace when Wapol ruled the island. The castle is extremely difficult to reach, requiring a treacherous climb up the mountains.
climate: Extreme cold at high altitude, heavy snow
politicalStatus: Formerly the royal palace, now Dr. Kureha's residence

description: A village on Drum Island where some of the island's inhabitants reside. Referenced in episode context as part of the island's geography.
